values.title: Fix memory leak in function that converts common::Image to msgs::Image

summary.html:
Hi, I'm gazebo GSoC applicant this year. Today I've faced with huge memory usage in my gazebo camera plugin.

This code caused couple of gigabytes memory usage in 5 minutes.

void OnNewFrame(
      const unsigned char *_image,
      unsigned int _width, unsigned int _height, unsigned int _depth,
      const std::string &_format)
  {
    common::Image image;
    image.SetFromData(_image, _width, _height, common::Image::ConvertPixelFormat(_format));

    ::msgs::Camera cameraMsg;
    msgs::Set(cameraMsg.mutable_frame(), image);

    cameraMsg.set_camera_type(this->type);

    this->cameraPublisher->Publish(cameraMsg);
  }

Changing Set function call to manually setting up my msgs::Image helped to fix this problem.

Then I looked at that function definition and found the problem.

      _i.GetData(&data, size);

Copies all bytes of _i into data variable.

      _msg->set_data(data, size);

This function is generated by protobuf and calls std::string::assign method inside which also copies memory of size "size" from data. After that nobody needs memory, allocated for data pointer, and nobody can delete it.

values.description:
Starting [from this run](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo_3.0/job/gazebo-gazebo_3.0-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/60/) we have a compiler warning produced by changes in JointController_TEST.

I've fixed it declaring all literals as unsigned, same type that returning the size() method

values.description:
[Current build of gazebo 3.0 on homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo_3.0/job/gazebo-gazebo_3.0-devel-homebrew_bcn-amd64-gpu-osX/5/) is broken, failing to link tinyxml libs.

I've added link directories where needed. This is only present in homebrew since tinyxml installations in linux is done in the default paths while homebrew uses an own path for installing dependencies.
values.title: Fix gazebo compilation on homebrew (-> 3.0)

summary.raw:
[Current build of gazebo 3.0 on homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo_3.0/job/gazebo-gazebo_3.0-devel-homebrew_bcn-amd64-gpu-osX/5/) is broken, failing to link tinyxml libs.

I've added link directories where needed. This is only present in homebrew since tinyxml installations in linux is done in the default paths while homebrew uses an own path for installing dependencies.
summary.html:
Current build of gazebo 3.0 on homebrew is broken, failing to link tinyxml libs.

I've added link directories where needed. This is only present in homebrew since tinyxml installations in linux is done in the default paths while homebrew uses an own path for installing dependencies.

values.description:
On Gazebo 1.9.X the gripper tag for grasping objects is not working, the joint is not created, in further versions (2.X+) this is fixed.
This patch adds the minimal changes and only on Gripper.cc and Gripper.hh to make it work.

(I started a discussion in gazebo mailing list here:
http://gazebosim.org/pipermail/gazebo-list/2014-April/000212.html

Which it's last answer is:
http://gazebosim.org/pipermail/gazebo-list/2014-April/000216.html
There you can find a video of it working.)

The branch is called "for_gazebo_1.9.3" but I checked on gazebo 1.9.5 also.
values.title: Fix for gripper tag work as grasp hack

On Gazebo 1.9.X the gripper tag for grasping objects is not working, the joint is not created, in further versions (2.X+) this is fixed.

(I started a discussion in gazebo mailing list here:
http://gazebosim.org/pipermail/gazebo-list/2014-April/000212.html

values.description:
issue #1134

- collada loader now tries to share vertices as much as possible

- prevent repeatedly parsing vertex/normal/texcoord values that have already been loaded, ISS load time dropped from >1 min to ~2 secs

- pimplize ColladaLoader class

- add a unit test that verifies all vertices are unique
values.title: Share vertices when loading a collada mesh, improve loader performance

summary.raw:
issue #1134

- collada loader now tries to share vertices as much as possible

- prevent repeatedly parsing vertex/normal/texcoord values that have already been loaded, ISS load time dropped from >1 min to ~2 secs

- pimplize ColladaLoader class

- add a unit test that verifies all vertices are unique
summary.html:
issue #1134

  • collada loader now tries to share vertices as much as possible

  • prevent repeatedly parsing vertex/normal/texcoord values that have already been loaded, ISS load time dropped from >1 min to ~2 secs

  • pimplize ColladaLoader class

  • add a unit test that verifies all vertices are unique

values.description:
Oculus support in Gazebo will be provided as an optional feature. You will need to install the Oculus SDK that will provide libOculusVR.so and OVR.h, among other header files.

How to test it:

* Install Oculus SDK.
* Add the following content to ~/.gazebo/gui.ini:

```
#!c++

[oculus]
x=0
y=0
visual=camera::link::visual
autolaunch=0
```
* Execute:

```
#!C++

gazebo ../worlds/camera.world
```
* Click on Window->Oculus Rift.

Alternatively, you can set:
```
#!c++

autolaunch=1
```
and run:
```
#!C++

gazebo ../worlds/camera.world
```

Here is a [test build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-quantal-amd64-gpu-nvidia/518/console).

You can use [this tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=oculus) for testing the pull request.
values.title: Oculus Rift support

and run:

Here is a test build.

You can use this tutorial for testing the pull request.

values.description:
This PR contains a fix for parsing of `force_torque`'s `frame`, adds parsing of new `measure_direction` and adds a unit test for checking the  correct implementation of this two tags.

It depends on [sdformat PR 98](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/98/add-new-tag-measure_direction-to/diff) .

For the discussion leading to this PR, please check [issue 940](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/940/force-torque-sensor-forcetorquesensorcc).
values.title: Add proper flexibility to force_torque sensor specification, solving issue #940

This PR contains a fix for parsing of `force_torque`'s `frame`, adds parsing of new `measure_direction` and adds a unit test for checking the  correct implementation of this two tags.

It depends on [sdformat PR 98](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/98/add-new-tag-measure_direction-to/diff) .

For the discussion leading to this PR, please check [issue 940](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/940/force-torque-sensor-forcetorquesensorcc).

For the discussion leading to this PR, please check issue 940.

values.description: `Collision::ConnectContact` and `Collision::DisconnectContact` were removed in gazebo 2.0, but were not listed in the Migration guide. This adds them to the migration guide and recommends replacements.
values.title: Update migration guide to include some removed functions and recommended replacements

summary.raw: `Collision::ConnectContact` and `Collision::DisconnectContact` were removed in gazebo 2.0, but were not listed in the Migration guide. This adds them to the migration guide and recommends replacements.
summary.html: Collision::ConnectContact and Collision::DisconnectContact were removed in gazebo 2.0, but were not listed in the Migration guide. This adds them to the migration guide and recommends replacements.

values.description:
This bug turns out to be a problem with the screw constraint row's erp term (c[i]) being improperly scaled down by thread_pitch in gazebo_3.0 branch.  The fix here checks |thread_pitch|, if it's larger than 1.0, the screw constraint row is length scaled, otherwise the screw constraint row is angular scaled.  This way we avoid instability when |thread_pitch| is very large, and the numerical values lead to instability (my guess for instability here is that we are reaching doubles precision limits in some parts of the system).

Also, I've cleanup cumulative angle calculation, including a bug fix that changes joint's `cumulative_angle` state when querying for joint angle.
values.title: patch for issue #1167, where pr2 screw joint is misbehaving (it's simply drifting).

summary.raw:
This bug turns out to be a problem with the screw constraint row's erp term (c[i]) being improperly scaled down by thread_pitch in gazebo_3.0 branch.  The fix here checks |thread_pitch|, if it's larger than 1.0, the screw constraint row is length scaled, otherwise the screw constraint row is angular scaled.  This way we avoid instability when |thread_pitch| is very large, and the numerical values lead to instability (my guess for instability here is that we are reaching doubles precision limits in some parts of the system).

Also, I've cleanup cumulative angle calculation, including a bug fix that changes joint's `cumulative_angle` state when querying for joint angle.
summary.html:
This bug turns out to be a problem with the screw constraint row's erp term (c[i]) being improperly scaled down by thread_pitch in gazebo_3.0 branch. The fix here checks |thread_pitch|, if it's larger than 1.0, the screw constraint row is length scaled, otherwise the screw constraint row is angular scaled. This way we avoid instability when |thread_pitch| is very large, and the numerical values lead to instability (my guess for instability here is that we are reaching doubles precision limits in some parts of the system).

Also, I've cleanup cumulative angle calculation, including a bug fix that changes joint's cumulative_angle state when querying for joint angle.

values.description:
- Re-arranged items in the left palette of the model editor as per new gazebo model editor design, [see pdf here]( #!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/d0046b3ac9795053a16cd10ab7da3bdcfae059ba/model_editor/ModelEditor_v4.pdf?at=default) 

- Also implemented new joint creation interface. Users will now create joints via a joint icon on the toolbar above the render window (previous via buttons in the left palette).

- The joint hotspot also gets a new visual representation - a cylinder with some thickness
values.title: Model editor's new joint maker interface

summary.raw:
- Re-arranged items in the left palette of the model editor as per new gazebo model editor design, [see pdf here]( #!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/d0046b3ac9795053a16cd10ab7da3bdcfae059ba/model_editor/ModelEditor_v4.pdf?at=default) 

- Also implemented new joint creation interface. Users will now create joints via a joint icon on the toolbar above the render window (previous via buttons in the left palette).

- The joint hotspot also gets a new visual representation - a cylinder with some thickness
summary.html:
• Re-arranged items in the left palette of the model editor as per new gazebo model editor design, see pdf here

  • Also implemented new joint creation interface. Users will now create joints via a joint icon on the toolbar above the render window (previous via buttons in the left palette).

  • The joint hotspot also gets a new visual representation - a cylinder with some thickness

values.reason: user study results showed that the joint creation process is still not very intuitive so will revisit design again.

values.description:
The `Joint::dampingCoefficient` variable is deprecated and was removed from the default branch by pull request #1067. However, the variable is still used by DARTJoint.cc, so the default build is broken when compiling against dart.

This replaces the reference to the deprecated `Joint::dampingCoefficient` with `Joint::dissipationCoefficient`. I targeted gazebo_3.0, but I will merge forward to default when this is merged.
values.title: Urgent: fix compilation of DARTJoint.cc

summary.raw:
The `Joint::dampingCoefficient` variable is deprecated and was removed from the default branch by pull request #1067. However, the variable is still used by DARTJoint.cc, so the default build is broken when compiling against dart.

This replaces the reference to the deprecated `Joint::dampingCoefficient` with `Joint::dissipationCoefficient`. I targeted gazebo_3.0, but I will merge forward to default when this is merged.
summary.html:
The Joint::dampingCoefficient variable is deprecated and was removed from the default branch by pull request #1067. However, the variable is still used by DARTJoint.cc, so the default build is broken when compiling against dart.

This replaces the reference to the deprecated Joint::dampingCoefficient with Joint::dissipationCoefficient. I targeted gazebo_3.0, but I will merge forward to default when this is merged.

values.description:
I've included multiple joint test and bug fixes in this pull request; sorry if that makes it difficult to follow.

1. Fix BulletSliderJoint::[GS]etVelocity. It wasn't working previously, so portions of joint_spawn.cc and 494_joint_axis_frame.cc were disabled. I have re-enabled these parts of the tests for prismatic joints. Thanks to @caguero for the patch to fix this, submitted a little while ago.

2. Fix BulletUniversalJoint limits. The limits were not being initialized properly from the sdf values. To verify this, I added some expectations to joint_universal.cc and modified the universal_joint_test.world slightly (build 963b29a5a1dd to verify the failing test). I believe this change to the test world doesn't compromise the other tests.

3. Enable joint axis frame testing for prismatic and universal joints (see changes to 494_joint_axis_frame.cc). This required fixes for ODEUniversalJoint::SetAxis and SimbodySliderJoint::GetGlobalAxis.

I found these while working on vehicle suspension modeling.

[Jenkins auto-build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/23/) as of a980263: clean apart from pr2 test failure (#1167) that will be fixed by pull request #1078
values.title: Multiple joint test fixes

I've included multiple joint test and bug fixes in this pull request; sorry if that makes it difficult to follow.

1. Fix BulletSliderJoint::[GS]etVelocity. It wasn't working previously, so portions of joint_spawn.cc and 494_joint_axis_frame.cc were disabled. I have re-enabled these parts of the tests for prismatic joints. Thanks to @caguero for the patch to fix this, submitted a little while ago.

2. Fix BulletUniversalJoint limits. The limits were not being initialized properly from the sdf values. To verify this, I added some expectations to joint_universal.cc and modified the universal_joint_test.world slightly (build 963b29a5a1dd to verify the failing test). I believe this change to the test world doesn't compromise the other tests.

3. Enable joint axis frame testing for prismatic and universal joints (see changes to 494_joint_axis_frame.cc). This required fixes for ODEUniversalJoint::SetAxis and SimbodySliderJoint::GetGlobalAxis.

I found these while working on vehicle suspension modeling.

[Jenkins auto-build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/23/) as of a980263: clean apart from pr2 test failure (#1167) that will be fixed by pull request #1078
summary.html:
I've included multiple joint test and bug fixes in this pull request; sorry if that makes it difficult to follow.

  1. Fix BulletSliderJoint::[GS]etVelocity. It wasn't working previously, so portions of joint_spawn.cc and 494_joint_axis_frame.cc were disabled. I have re-enabled these parts of the tests for prismatic joints. Thanks to @caguero for the patch to fix this, submitted a little while ago.

  2. Fix BulletUniversalJoint limits. The limits were not being initialized properly from the sdf values. To verify this, I added some expectations to joint_universal.cc and modified the universal_joint_test.world slightly (build 963b29a5a1dd to verify the failing test). I believe this change to the test world doesn't compromise the other tests.

  3. Enable joint axis frame testing for prismatic and universal joints (see changes to 494_joint_axis_frame.cc). This required fixes for ODEUniversalJoint::SetAxis and SimbodySliderJoint::GetGlobalAxis.

I found these while working on vehicle suspension modeling.

Jenkins auto-build as of a980263: clean apart from pr2 test failure (#1167) that will be fixed by pull request #1078

values.description:
Minor code optmization. Found this while porting changes from pull request #1066 to pull request #1075. 

~~This does not change the behavior of ColladaLoader. The texture coordinates loaded by ColladaLoader remain the same.~~

Update: Found out that cordless drill texture coordinates were incorrect and fixed duplicate texcoord indices. 15763b0.
values.title: Minor change to ColladaLoader's LoadPolylist and LoadTexCoords

summary.raw:
Minor code optmization. Found this while porting changes from pull request #1066 to pull request #1075. 

~~This does not change the behavior of ColladaLoader. The texture coordinates loaded by ColladaLoader remain the same.~~

Update: Found out that cordless drill texture coordinates were incorrect and fixed duplicate texcoord indices. 15763b0.
summary.html:
Minor code optmization. Found this while porting changes from pull request #1066 to pull request #1075.

This does not change the behavior of ColladaLoader. The texture coordinates loaded by ColladaLoader remain the same.

Update: Found out that cordless drill texture coordinates were incorrect and fixed duplicate texcoord indices. 15763b0.

values.description:
Two new plugins:

* HydraPlugin: Publish messages on the topic ~hydra with the state of the controller.
* HydraPluginDemo: Model plugin that uses HydraPlugin to move a model using the right joystick.

Here is a new [Hydra tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=hydra).

For testing follow the tutorial, and then:


```
#!c++

gazebo ../worlds/hydra_demo.world
```
values.title: Razer Hydra support

values.description:
Use helper_physics_generator for ImuSensor_TEST and remove workarounds for bullet 2.81, since we now require bullet 2.82.

Also, I relaxed the tolerance on the z component of the linear acceleration when the test box is in contact with the ground, since simbody doesn't have completely inelastic collisions.

Waiting on [Jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/31)
values.title: Update ImuSensor_TEST

summary.raw:
Use helper_physics_generator for ImuSensor_TEST and remove workarounds for bullet 2.81, since we now require bullet 2.82.

Also, I relaxed the tolerance on the z component of the linear acceleration when the test box is in contact with the ground, since simbody doesn't have completely inelastic collisions.

Waiting on [Jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/31)
summary.html:
Use helper_physics_generator for ImuSensor_TEST and remove workarounds for bullet 2.81, since we now require bullet 2.82.

Also, I relaxed the tolerance on the z component of the linear acceleration when the test box is in contact with the ground, since simbody doesn't have completely inelastic collisions.

Waiting on Jenkins build

values.description:
Proper return values for failure cases of:

 * Implementing the return of EXIT_FAILURE for gzserver, when it detects that an exception was thrown.
 * In gazebo, check the exit of execpv and return according.

Details and motivation in #1178.
values.title: Return failure to system if exit abnormally. Issue #1178. (-> 2.2)

summary.raw:

 * Implementing the return of EXIT_FAILURE for gzserver, when it detects that an exception was thrown.
 * In gazebo, check the exit of execpv and return according.

Details and motivation in #1178.

values.description:
It's been [failing in Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64/1123/testReport/junit/%28root%29/REGRESSION_940_force_torque_sensor_frame/test_ran/) since [sdformat pull request 98](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/98/add-new-tag-measure_direction-to) hasn't been released yet.
~~~
219: [ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/Issue940Test.ForceTorqueSensorFrameTest/0
219: [Msg] Waiting for master.
219: [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
219: [Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.19
219: [Err] [RenderEngine.cc:665] Can't open display: 
219: [Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:88] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
219: Error [parser.cc:702] XML Element[measure_direction], child of element[force_torque] not defined in SDF. Ignoring.[force_torque]
219: Error [parser.cc:693] Error reading element <force_torque>
219: Error [parser.cc:693] Error reading element <sensor>
219: Error [parser.cc:693] Error reading element <joint>
219: Error [parser.cc:693] Error reading element <model>
219: Error [parser.cc:693] Error reading element <world>
219: Error [parser.cc:353] Unable to read element <sdf>
219: Error [parser_urdf.cc:2635] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
219: Error [parser.cc:278] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
219: [Err] [Server.cc:299] Unable to read sdf file[worlds/force_torque_frame_test.world]
219: [Err] [PhysicsIface.cc:61] no worlds
219: [Err] [PhysicsIface.cc:75] Unable to find world by name in physics::get_world[]
219: [Err] [Exception.cc:52] EXCEPTION: Unable to find world by name in physics::get_world(world_name)
219: 
219: terminate called after throwing an instance of 'gazebo::common::Exception'
219: 
 7/20 Test #219: REGRESSION_940_force_torque_sensor_frame ...........***Exception: Other  0.28 sec
~~~
I've made a [pull request to bump the patch number of sdformat](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/99/bump-sdformat-patch-number-for-development) on the sdf_2.0 branch, so that using a source build of sdformat will enable this test.
values.title: Disable REGRESSION_940_force_torque_sensor_frame for sdformat 2.0.0 and earlier

I've made a pull request to bump the patch number of sdformat on the sdf_2.0 branch, so that using a source build of sdformat will enable this test.

values.description:
issue #1133

- crash was caused by the event system calling the function of a deleted object (Visual::Update).

- updated Visual to use a shared pointer when binding to the preRender event. This keeps the visual object alive for one extra iteration until it's properly disconnected from the event system.
values.title: Fix deleting sun

summary.raw:
issue #1133

- crash was caused by the event system calling the function of a deleted object (Visual::Update).

- updated Visual to use a shared pointer when binding to the preRender event. This keeps the visual object alive for one extra iteration until it's properly disconnected from the event system.
summary.html:
issue #1133

  • crash was caused by the event system calling the function of a deleted object (Visual::Update).

  • updated Visual to use a shared pointer when binding to the preRender event. This keeps the visual object alive for one extra iteration until it's properly disconnected from the event system.

values.description:
There is a big cmake warning that appears if DART is not installed. This warning message also makes using `ccmake` cumbersome.

This pull request suppresses cmake's warning, and instead displays that dart was not found.
values.title: Quiet the cmake warnings when DART is not present

summary.raw:
There is a big cmake warning that appears if DART is not installed. This warning message also makes using `ccmake` cumbersome.

This pull request suppresses cmake's warning, and instead displays that dart was not found.
summary.html:
There is a big cmake warning that appears if DART is not installed. This warning message also makes using ccmake cumbersome.

This pull request suppresses cmake's warning, and instead displays that dart was not found.

values.description: `Model::GetLinks` would cause a segfault if the returned array of shared pointers was used. This is because the stored shared pointer would become out-of-scope and get deleted.
values.title: Fix Model::GetLinks

summary.raw: `Model::GetLinks` would cause a segfault if the returned array of shared pointers was used. This is because the stored shared pointer would become out-of-scope and get deleted.
summary.html: Model::GetLinks would cause a segfault if the returned array of shared pointers was used. This is because the stored shared pointer would become out-of-scope and get deleted.

values.description:
issue #1182 and issue #346

changes:

- Stopped Scene from republishing light msgs so lights don't get re-spawned. Consequently, had to change ModelListWidget to update lights via the `lightUpdate` events 

- Updated MainWindow to create a request for `scene_info` on startup so it also gets light information  (which then signals the `lightUpdate` event)

- Added a `msgs::LightToSDF` method to convert protobuf msgs to sdf so we can insert it into the world sdf.
values.title: Fix deleting and saving light on server

summary.raw:
issue #1182 and issue #346

changes:

- Stopped Scene from republishing light msgs so lights don't get re-spawned. Consequently, had to change ModelListWidget to update lights via the `lightUpdate` events 

- Updated MainWindow to create a request for `scene_info` on startup so it also gets light information  (which then signals the `lightUpdate` event)

- Added a `msgs::LightToSDF` method to convert protobuf msgs to sdf so we can insert it into the world sdf.
summary.html:
issue #1182 and issue #346

changes:

  • Stopped Scene from republishing light msgs so lights don't get re-spawned. Consequently, had to change ModelListWidget to update lights via the lightUpdate events

  • Updated MainWindow to create a request for scene_info on startup so it also gets light information (which then signals the lightUpdate event)

  • Added a msgs::LightToSDF method to convert protobuf msgs to sdf so we can insert it into the world sdf.

summary.html: introduction of Joint::SetPosition breaks ABI.

values.description:
issue #996

it was segfaulting due to null materials so the solution is to set submeshes to use the Gazebo/White material as default.

There are still some problems with ogre 1.9, one of them is that shadows are not working.
values.title: Fix gzclient startup crash with ogre 1.9

summary.raw:
issue #996

it was segfaulting due to null materials so the solution is to set submeshes to use the Gazebo/White material as default.

There are still some problems with ogre 1.9, one of them is that shadows are not working.
summary.html:
issue #996

it was segfaulting due to null materials so the solution is to set submeshes to use the Gazebo/White material as default.

There are still some problems with ogre 1.9, one of them is that shadows are not working.

values.description:
The `Base::GetScopedName` was incorrect. The `if` clause would stop the name construction one level too early.

This pull request fixes this problem, and adds a couple tests.

[Jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-abichecker-precise-amd64/42/)
values.title: Fix for Base::GetScopedName

summary.raw:
